slides.title: Corrugated
slides.caption: In the Southwest, corrugated pots existed in various forms between AD 650-1450. By leaving coils unobliliterated, potters manipulated the exposed coils to make a rough exterior.
slides.source: Courtesy of School of American Research, Catalog Number IAF.1930. Photograph by Addison Doty.

slides.title: Mimbres Black-on-White
slides.caption: Ceramic bowl created by the Mogollon people who lived near the Mimbres River, c. 1000-1150 AD. Height: 3 3/4 in. (9.525 cm) Diameter: 7 in. (17.78 cm)
slides.source: Courtesy of Dallas Museum of Art, Foundation for the Arts Collection, anonymous gift

slides.title: Acoma Pottery
slides.caption: This pot is an example of the work of Acoma artisans.
